physical_examinations.vital_signs: AST, 93 U/L; ALT, 228 U/L; Hemoglobin, 17.6 g/dL
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Skin fragility, blistering on the dorsal hands and forearms, erosions, scarring, hypertrichosis over the temples.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Persistent, mildly increased aminotransferase concentrations were noted with no significant clinical improvement after nine phlebotomy sessions.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: AST, 38 U/L; ALT, 52 U/L; Hemoglobin, 17.1 g/dL
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Further investigations showed persistent, mildly increased aminotransferase concentrations; minimal abnormal results in serum iron studies.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Phlebotomy frequency was increased to weekly after identifying HFE C282Y mutation; a complete clinical response in PCT signs achieved within 6 weeks.
